--output.desc: The format to be converted to. "json" (default) -- convert csv to json. "csv" -- convert csv to csv row array. "line" -- convert csv to csv line string

--delimiter.desc: delimiter to separate columns. Possible to give an array or just use 'auto'. default comma (,). e.g. --delimiter=# --delimiter='[",",";"]' --delimiter=auto

--quote.desc: quote surrounding a column content containing delimiters. To turn off quote, please use 'off' --quote=off. default double quote ("). e.g. chage to hash: --quote=#

--trim.desc: Indicate if parser trim off spaces surrounding column content. e.g. " content " will be trimmed to "content". Default: true

--checkType.desc: This parameter turns on and off whether check field type. default is false.

--ignoreEmpty.desc: This parameter turns on and off whether ignore empty column values while parsing. default is false

--noheader.desc: Indicating csv data has no header row and first row is data row. Default is false

--headers.desc: An array to specify the headers of CSV data. If --noheader is false, this value will override CSV header. Default: null. Example: --headers='["my field","name"]'

--flatKeys.desc: Don't interpret dots (.) and square brackets in header fields as nested object or array identifiers at all (treat them like regular characters for JSON field identifiers). Default: false.

--maxRowLength.desc: the max character a csv row could have. 0 means infinite. If max number exceeded, parser will emit "error" of "row_exceed". if a possibly corrupted csv data provided, give it a number like 65535 so the parser wont consume memory. default: 10240

--checkColumn.desc: whether check column number of a row is the same as headers. If column number mismatched headers number, an error of "mismatched_column" will be emitted.. default: false

--eol.desc: Explicitly specify the end of line character to use.

--quiet.desc: If any error happens, quit the process quietly rather than log out the error. Default is false.

--escape.desc: escape character used in quoted column. Default is double quote (") according to RFC4108. Change to back slash (\) or other chars for your own case.

--ignoreColumns.desc: RegExp matched columns to ignore from input. e.g. --ignoreColumns=/(name|age)/

--includeColumns.desc: RegExp matched columns to include from input. e.g. --includeColumns=/(name|age)/

--alwaysSplitAtEOL.desc: Always interpret each line (as defined by eol) as a row. This will prevent eol characters from being used within a row (even inside a quoted field). This ensures that misplaced quotes only break on row, and not all ensuing rows.
